page.title: 08Dalbury Church - Building
page.content: 11th C. Mentioned in original {Domesday Survey}. Bell tower . Stained Glass window of{St. Michael}- 12th C. (restored 1980 by{York Glaziers Trust) Extension - Victorian times . 2 Bells - Not rung . Large tiered alabaster pulpit in nave . 2 wooden chairs in chancel, dated 1689 & 1895(replica). Carved wooden lectern. Mohogony Encased Chamber organ. 18th C Royal Coat of Arms. Boxed wooden pews.{Wooden Cartouche over altar - Angels and wooden carving in nave thought to be done by a previous rector. Very dark east window showing{Crucifixion.}Plaque on one side showing 1O Commandments, plaque on other side showing Creed. {Lamps, originally oil, converted to electricity.
